image.altText: Australian players celebrate with Mitchell Starc after a wicket

items.synopsis: Australia set a trap and lead England's Bazballers straight into it in a bizarre final session on the second day of the second Test at Lord's.

title.children: Wickets fall and runs flow in 'stupid' final session on day two at Lord's

image.altText: Japanese and Australian navies conduct joint exercises

items.synopsis: An Australian warship and surveillance aircraft have conducted military exercises with Japan in the South China Sea under the close watch of the People's Liberation Army.

title.children: Australia and Japan conduct war games in contested waters as China watches closely

image.altText: Close up of a sign advertising a house for sale in Brisbane.

items.synopsis: An increasing number of Australians are selling homes that they have owned for fewer than two years, many at a loss, and analysts warn it might be an early sign of mortgage distress.

title.children: More recent buyers are reselling their homes, and that may be an early sign of mortgage troubles

image.altText: Short sleeved dark navy police t-shirt, viewed from back of officer in uniform

items.synopsis: A crime scene has been established after a man was found dead inside a Tamborine Mountain home on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Police have launched a homicide investigation after a man was found dead at a Queensland property

image.altText: Police officer confronts man at Strathpine

items.synopsis: The man was told to remain in the car, but repeatedly kicked the door into the officer in an attempt to leave it, police said.

title.children: Man who was repeatedly punched by police officer following car crash charged

image.altText: A woman speaks in front of several microphones

items.synopsis: The 688 page Operation Keppel report released by ICAC covered a lot of ground. Here are the key findings.

title.children: 'I am the boss, even when you're the premier': Key findings from the Gladys Berejiklian ICAC report

image.altText: Joe Root pats Ben Duckett on the shoulder

items.synopsis: A slow second day at Lord's explodes into "madness" in the final session as Australia's bouncer barrage bumps up against the English batters' uber aggressive approach.

title.children: Five quick hits — Joe Root gifted an extra life and a GOAT cut down

image.altText: A red mark on a map shows the origin of the quake relative to the Victorian capital of Melbourne.

items.synopsis: Seismologists say a moderate earthquake has occurred in the high country east of Melbourne.

title.children: Tremors felt in Melbourne as magnitude-4.6 earthquake strikes Victoria

image.altText: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews at Tiananmen Square in China.

items.synopsis: Mr Andrews spent four days meeting senior officials in Beijing, Nanjing and Chengdu before returning to a hostile reception in Melbourne.

title.children: Victorian taxpayers billed more than $80,000 for Daniel Andrews' latest trip to China

image.altText: Sunak speaks in front of a lectern emblazoned with the slogan 'stop the boats'

items.synopsis: The UK Government loses a court challenge over its plan to deport asylum seekers who arrive by boat to Rwanda, but says it will pursue its own appeal to get the scheme off the ground.

title.children: 'Your government should decide who comes here': Sunak reacts after court rules Rwanda asylum plan unlawful

image.altText: A firefighter holds a hose as a car is alight, covered in bright orange flames, in the background.

items.synopsis: Police clash with protesters across France amid riots over the deadly police shooting of a 17-year-old boy during a traffic stop.

title.children: Mother of French teen shot dead by police leads rally as violence spreads across France

image.altText: Melissa McIntosh, Marise Payne and Scott Morrison look at construction plans

items.synopsis: A Labor-dominated parliamentary committee has criticised the former Coalition government for "industrial-scale rorting for blatantly partisan purposes", while calling for changes to grant processes to ensure taxpayers get the best value for money.

title.children: 'Industrial-scale rorting': Labor-led committee slams former Coalition government's grants programs

image.altText: A middle-aged man with dark hair in a tight olive green military T-shirt stands at a podium in front of the Ukrainian flag.

items.synopsis: "Anyone who helps Russian terrorists destroy lives deserves the maximum punishment," President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said in his nightly video message on Wednesday.

title.children: Satellite images hint at Wagner build-up in Belarus, as Ukraine arrests man over missile attack

image.altText: A police car and police tape is seen in front of a house

items.synopsis: A psychiatrist tells WA's Supreme Court a man who killed his parents was so mentally ill, he believed he had "no other option" and was doing what was "morally right".

title.children: 'They're both in their beds dead': Court hears man felt killing his parents was 'morally right'

image.altText: A closeup of debris from the Titan submersible pictured under a blue tarp, tied down with yellow straps.

items.synopsis: Debris from OceanGate's tourist submersible Titan, that was lost with five passengers aboard, has been recovered and returned to the mainland in Canada. What happens next?

title.children: What is an implosion? What happens with the debris of the Titan submersible? And more questions answered

image.altText: Skyspan umbrella at Cairns School of Distance Education on left, school building with ramps on right

items.synopsis: Education Queensland has admitted to destroying trees planted in memory of deceased teachers as part of spending blitz at distance education school.

title.children: Queensland’s second largest school builds $700k playground despite nearly all 4,300 students learning from home

image.altText: A man in a cowboy hat leans down and fixes an engine

items.synopsis: Known for his "cheeky smile" and "quick wit", 32-year-old Tom Grey died in a plane crash last year that was "not considered survivable" by Australian Transport and Safety Bureau investigators.

title.children: Bird strike caused Chinchilla plane crash that killed 'lovable' pilot, safety bureau finds

image.altText: Biden speaks on the Supreme Court ruling on affirmative action.

items.synopsis: US President Joe Biden says he "strongly" disagrees with the US Supreme Court's ruling banning the use of race and ethnicity in university admission decisions.

title.children: Biden 'strongly' objects as Supreme Court shoots down affirmative action for colleges

image.altText: A picture of a smiling woman with grey hair and glasses inset in a circle with flowers on it

items.synopsis: SA Police suspect two elderly people, who died one year apart, may have been murdered by the same person after abnormalities in both of their toxicology reports were found.

title.children: 'We believe both were murdered': Police open major crime investigation into deaths of elderly couple

image.altText: Celine Cremer smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Tasmania Police searching for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer say they have received expert medical advice the weather conditions she is lost in for at least nine days are "not survivable".

title.children: 'Not survivable': Growing concerns for Belgian tourist Celine Cremer as Tasmanian weather deteriorates

image.altText: Richard Marles with short grey hair wearing grey suit holds a plaque with Manasseh Sogavare in a black suit

items.synopsis: Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles says Australia is willing to continue providing troops and police support to Solomon Islands.

title.children: Marles commits to ongoing defence, security support for Solomon Islands

image.altText: Brisbane Lions AFL player Charlie Cameron reaches up with his hand to flick the ball behind him to his team's advantage.

items.synopsis: Dustin Martin may have been missing for Richmond but not even he would have made the difference as the Tigers were hopelessly outclassed by Brisbane at the Gabba.

title.children: Daniher boots five as Lions maul Tigers at Gabbatoir

image.altText: A Cronulla Sharks NRL player passes the ball to his right against St George Illawarra Drgaons.

items.synopsis: Ben Hunt has spent the week in the headlines but it was opposite number Nicho Hynes who stole the show as Cronulla eased to a 52-16 NRL thrashing of troubled St George Illawarra.

title.children: Sharks thrash Dragons as Hynes stars in local derby

image.altText: Participants parade with Turkmen flags, artificial flowers and white balloons in front of a new, white city.

items.synopsis: Gurbanguly Berdymukhamedov developed one of the most extraordinary personality cults in the world during the 15 years he ran the secretive ex-Soviet nation of Turkmenistan. Now a city has been built in his honour.

title.children: Turkmenistan unveils $7.5 billion 'smart city' with all white buildings in honour of former strongman leader

image.altText: A fluffy dog with blue eyes sits on the ground, as someone uses a syrienge to inject medicine into its mouth.

items.synopsis: The corporate regulator allows dozens of pet insurance policies to go back on the market after issuing a ban that lasted less than a day.

title.children: Pet insurance ban lifted after Woolworths, RSPCA, Guide Dogs and more pull policies

image.altText: A low cloud hanging over Uluru in June 2023

items.synopsis: It's a forecast that sounds unbelievable, but the Bureau of Meteorology says there's "the most outside chance" of snowfall on the cards for central Australia this weekend.

title.children: Snow in the NT this weekend? It's not impossible. Here's what it would take

image.altText: A car on the street

items.synopsis: Deputy Commissioner Murray Smalpage says Alice Springs' crime rate has fallen to its lowest level in four years — but NT Police are yet to back that up.

title.children: 'It doesn't stack up': NT Police fail to back up claim Alice Springs crime rate at lowest point in years

image.altText: A man sitting on the ground and a woman bending down shaking hands, in front of a group of people.

items.synopsis: Calling out to the spirit of their sister, Ngeygo Ragurrk's family welcomed a contingent of lawyers, police and media to the scene of her horrific death, which is the subject of an ongoing coronial inquest.

title.children: 'She's here with us': Family of DV victim takes coroner to scene of fatal attack

image.altText: A police officer points at a woman near a car

items.synopsis: A SA police officer accused of the aggravated assault of an intoxicated young woman tells a court he struck her twice using the soft, bottom-part of his first, not his knuckles, as the prosecution alleged.

title.children: Police officer seen hitting woman in court video after she stopped grabbing him

image.altText: three male faces

items.synopsis: Gladys Berejiklian is the New South Wales ICAC's latest high-profile casualty, but she's not the first. The former premier joins a long list of powerful political careers derailed by the nation's longest-running corruption watchdog.

title.children: Berejiklian joins other high profile politicians who have had their political career derailed by NSW corruption watchdog

image.altText: A woman smiling, looking into the camera

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has been told Hunter woman Danielle Easey was killed after making threats against people in the local drug scene.

title.children: Danielle Easey was allegedly murdered after 'the crack ran out and she lost it', jury told

image.altText: King Charles smiles and looks to the left.

items.synopsis: The annual report into royals' taxpayer-funded spending reveals the King has requested thermostats in royal homes be turned down to 19 degrees Celsius, and details how much was sent on the Queen's funeral.

title.children: Inflation hits royal finances as King Charles turns down heating to save emissions

image.altText: Illustration of black holes and gravitational waves

items.synopsis: Astronomers around the world have found the first hints of elusive fingerprint of gravitational waves created by monster black holes at the centre of galaxies.

title.children: 'It's like an ocean': Space-time is warped by a background of gravitational waves, and astronomers may have detected it for the first time
